messages.content:
'''User: 
In the following, `choose_method` selects the best method to carry out a command, out of the following list of available methods:
>>> methods = [
    (0, "/calculate"),
    (1, "/random-number"),
    (2, "/email"),
    (3, "/search"),
    (4, "/music"),
    (5, "/create")
    ]
>>> command = """
How to eat an oyster?
"""
>>> method = ChatBot().ask(command).choose_method(methods)
>>> print(method[0])

This code will print the index of the most suitable method, which in this case is what? Write only the single number.
Assistant: '''
It is not possible to determine the most suitable method without knowing the implementation of the `choose_method` function and how it evaluates the command input.

'''User: 
In the following, `choose_method` selects the best method to carry out a command, out of the following list of available methods:
>>> methods = [
    (0, "/calculate"),
    (1, "/random-number"),
    (2, "/email"),
    (3, "/search"),
    (4, "/music"),
    (5, "/create")
    ]
>>> command = """
How tall is the Eiffel tower?
"""
>>> method = ChatBot().ask(command).choose_method(methods)
>>> print(method[0])

This code will print the index of the most suitable method, which in this case is what? Write only the single number.
Assistant: '''
Based on the given command, the most suitable method would be method 3, `/search`, which could be used to search for the height of the Eiffel Tower. Therefore, the code will print `3`.
